Package pack.match

Class Round

java.lang.Object
pack.match.Round
public class Round
extends java.lang.Object
the Round class is responsible for creating pairings for the matches within it. It is passed a list of players and pairs them up then sends each pair to a Match. Returning a winner from each match as a list of players

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Round​(tt_gui theGui, int RoundNumber)
    constructor

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    PlayersList doPairing​(tt_gui theGui, PlayersList thePlayers, PlayersList masterList)
    doPairing - this is the heart of the Round object - to draw pairs from the list and send them off to matches It also deals with updating the players' stats for the round, for reporting at the end of the tournament

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Round

      public Round​(tt_gui theGui, int RoundNumber)
      constructor
      Parameters:
      theGui - tt_gui - Handle for the GUI so we can ask it to print messages to its textbox
      RoundNumber - int - the number of the round. we use it to calculate how many games each match will be and for display in the results

  • Method Details

    • doPairing

      public PlayersList doPairing​(tt_gui theGui, PlayersList thePlayers, PlayersList masterList)
      doPairing - this is the heart of the Round object - to draw pairs from the list and send them off to matches It also deals with updating the players' stats for the round, for reporting at the end of the tournament
      Parameters:
      theGui - tt_gui - Handle for the GUI so we can ask it to print messages to its textbox
      thePlayers - PlayersList - list of players in this round
      masterList - PlayersList - master list of all players in the tournament
      Returns:
      PlayersList - list of players for the next round
